'''David Bradley''' (born 17 April 1942) is an English actor. He is best known for his recurring role as Argus Filch in the [[wikipedia:Harry Potter (film series)|''Harry Potter'']] movies. He started acting on stage in 1971, and won a [[wikipedia:Laurence Olivier Award|Laurence Olivier Award]] in 1991 for a supporting role in [[wikipedia:King Lear|''King Lear'']]. His more recent credits include [[wikipedia:The Sarah Jane Adventures|''The Sarah Jane Adventures'']], [[wikipedia:Dinosaurs On A Spaceship|''Doctor Who'']],Â ''[[wikipedia:Ashes to Ashes (TV series)|Ashes to Ashes]]'', ''[[wikipedia:The Tudors|The Tudors]]'', and ''[[wikipedia:The Colour of Magic (TV film)|The Colour of Magic]]'', as well as the film [[wikipedia:Hot Fuzz|''Hot Fuzz'']].

In ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' he is playing the role of Lord [[Walder Frey]], and was announced in the role on 24 November 2010. With the character heading the [[Red Wedding]] massacre, Bradley himself has stated that he would like to see Walder Frey die a painful death.
